label: 巡察使
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Temporary officials who made tours of the country to see how the Provincial (Kokushi) and District Officials (Gunji) were conducting their governments, and to inquire into the people's troubles. Their number and routes differed from time to time. [国司、郡司]
